title: Stocks flirt with record highs as US-China trade tension eases
text:
New York (CNN Business) Nothing is spooking investors on this particular Friday the 13th. The Dow was up on the news that China will exempt US soybeans and pork from its next round of tariffs.

The Dow gained nearly 40 points and is inching toward a record. The S&P 500 was flat but within striking distance of a new all-time high while as well. The tech-heavy Nasdaq fell slightly.

It's been a stellar week for stocks, thanks to the US and China extending olive branches to one another.

Earlier this week, China agreed to exempt shrimp, cancer drugs, pesticides and more than a dozen other products from tariffs.

US President Donald Trump responded with a conciliatory move of his own, agreeing to delay a planned tariff increase from October 1 until October 15 in what Trump called " a gesture of good will" in a tweet.

Read More
description: Nothing is spooking investors on this particular Friday the 13th. The Dow was up on the news that China will exempt US soybeans and pork from its next round of tariffs.
